intro: Paronychia manicata, commonly known as the "manicured plant," is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. It produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Paronychia manicata is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
